name: prismatic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
containing, shaped like, or relating to a prism (= a transparent glass or plastic object that separates white light into different colours): a prismatic compass The mineral often occurs as long, white prismatic crystals.
consisting of many different bright colours, like those separated from white light by a prism: When the sun rose a hundred prismatic hues were reflected from it. A flash of prismatic light appeared on the edge of the glass.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company makes battery packs using brick-size prismatic cells. Lack of coordination of the eye muscles can be corrected with prismatic glasses.He liked the prismatic effects of icicles.The artist uses a prismatic palette of colors that, as the name implies, approximates the pure, transparent colors of sunlight refracted through a prism.His lighting casts a prismatic carpet of light on the stage.
